pageProps.content:
RATE

USD 12,000 + per person

AREAS

Windhoek, Sossusvlei, Kunene, Etosha (10 nights)

Trip Summary

  • 1 night: The Olive Exclusive, Windhoek – Namibia
  • 3 nights: Little Kulala, Sossusvlei – Namibia
  • 3 nights: Serra Cafema, Kunene – Namibia
  • 3 nights: Little Ongava, Etosha – Namibia

Trip Overview

Day 1:

Upon arrival at Windhoek International Airport, you will be transferred by road to The Olive Exclusive in Windhoek, Namibia.

Overnight at The Olive Exclusive in a junior suite on a bed & breakfast basis.

Day 2:

Road transfer from The Olive Exclusive to Windhoek International Airport.

Light air transfer from Windhoek International Airport to Little Kulala in Sossusvlei, Namibia.

Day 2 – 5:

Spend 3 nights at Little Kulala in a luxury desert suite on a fully inclusive basis.

During your stay, you will take a scenic hot air balloon flight over the red sand dunes, followed by a lovely champagne breakfast.

Day 5:

Light air transfer from Little Kulala to Serra Cafema in the Kunene, Namibia.

Day 5 – 8:

Spend 3 nights at Serra Cafema in a luxury tented villa on a fully inclusive basis.

Day 8:

Light air transfer from Serra Cafema to Little Ongava in Etosha, Namibia.

Day 8 - 11:

Spend 3 nights at Little Ongava in a luxury suite on a fully inclusive basis.

Day 11:

Light air transfer from Little Ongava to Windhoek International Airport.

Depart Windhoek International Airport as per own arrangements.

End of trip.

Inclusions

  • Light air transfers
  • All mentioned private tours & activities
  • All mentioned accommodations
  • On safari: All meals, drinks (soft & alcoholic) & activities
  • Elsewhere: Bed & breakfast basis

Exclusions

  • International flights
  • Visas (if necessary)
  • Travel Insurance

subfolders.title: THE OLIVE EXCLUSIVE
subfolders.description:
Contemporary & stylish, The Olive Exclusive is tucked away in a quiet corner of Windhoek – Namibia’s capital city.
Small & intimate, The Olive Exclusive is a luxurious choice for the discerning traveller hoping to stay over in Windhoek before or after a Namibia safari, & the ideal base from which to explore the city & surrounds.

The Olive Exclusive has 7 individually decorated suites, reflecting the different regions in Namibia.  
Each suite has a lounge area with a fireplace, a dining room for in-room dining as well as a spacious deck with a day bed & private plunge pool.
The restaurant at The Olive boasts a seasonal menu, offering inventive & signature dishes & the well-stocked bar features a classic selection of fine whisky & premium wines.

Activities at The Olive Exclusive include getting pampered in the wellness spa, taking a refreshing dip in the swimming pool & private plunge pool or booking day trips to the city centre.

subfolders.title: LITTLE KULALA
subfolders.description:
Little Kulala is a luxurious desert lodge situated in the 37,000 Kulala Wilderness Reserve – the gateway to Namibia’s towering red sand dunes & clear starry skies.
Little Kulala is one of Namibia’s secret gems - providing a remote location, stylish interiors, excellent service, exciting activities & magnificent desert views.

Accommodation at Little Kulala consists of 11 luxury desert suites.  
Each suite is set against the beautiful backdrop of Namibia’s desert landscape & features a private plunge pool, a rooftop ‘sky bed’ for romantic stargazing & an en-suite bathroom with both indoor & outdoor showers.
The main area comprises a library, wine cellar, lounge & dining room.  The interiors have been designed to provide an all-natural safari experience in this gorgeous desert environment.

Game viewing from the comfort of the lodge includes frequent sightings of desert-adapted wildlife such as ostrich, springbok & gemsbok.  Smaller creatures such as bat-eared fox & aardwolf can be seen at night.
Morning guided drives to the spectacular red sand dunes of Sossusvlei is most often the highlight of any Namibian excursion.  Hot-air balloon safaris will allow guests to soar high above the picturesque landscape of Sossusvlei.
Other exciting activities include hiking, day trips to Dead Vlei & Sesriem Canyon, scenic sundowner excursions, guided scorpion night walks, quad biking, e-biking, star bed sleep-outs & stargazing.

subfolders.title: SERRA CAFEMA
subfolders.description:
Serra Cafema, one of Southern Africa's most remote camps, is located within the far north-west corner of Namibia in an area known as the Kunene region.
Located on the Kunene River, the region's only water source – Serra Cafema enjoys sensational views of the lush green riverbanks.  
The camp is only reachable by small plane (3 hours from Windhoek), making this a stylish off-the-beaten-track safari destination.

Serra Cafema is an intimate camp consisting of 8 riverside Meru-style canvas & thatched tented villas built on elevated decks.  One of these tents is a family unit consisting of 2 en-suite bedrooms.  
Each tent features an en suite bathroom with an indoor & outdoor shower, an expansive wooden deck with a dining area, a hammock & a comfortable bench with breathtaking river views.  
The Serra Cafema 'Ozonganda,' or main area, comprises indoor & outdoor dining areas, a sunken lounge, library & swimming pool, all sharing views of the beautiful Kunene River.

Guests can enjoy informative nature drives & carefully guided quad bike excursions through the fragile dunes to have a true Namib Desert experience.

subfolders.title: LITTLE ONGAVA
subfolders.description:
Little Ongava is one of Namibia’s most luxurious & exclusive safari camps.  Built on a rocky outcrop in the Ongava Game Reserve to the south of Etosha, the lodge provides awe-inspiring views over the reserve.
The Etosha National Park is one of Africa’s largest game parks & boasts a variety of wildlife & large herds of plains game.  The elusive black rhino can also be found here.

Little Ongava, as the name suggests, consists of only 3 spacious, luxurious & private suites.  Here guests will experience remote exclusivity like nowhere else in the country.
Each suite features a private plunge pool, a sala & an en suite bathroom with both indoor & outdoor showers for those wishing to get closer to nature.  The bath has a magnificent view over the surrounding reserve.  
The main lodge consists of a dining & lounge area, both looking out over the waterhole below.

Excellent photographic opportunities can be enjoyed from the 4x4 game drive vehicle or animal hide overlooking the waterhole.  
Frequent sightings of lion, elephant, gemsbok, springbok, red hartebeest & white & black rhino can be expected.  For the adventurous at heart - white rhino can also be tracked on foot.
